Bibliographic Ghosts: San Marino, CA, Henry Huntington Library HM 144 [olim Huth 7], f. 55: actually in HM 744.
_description: Thomas Hoccleve, ‘Learn to Die’ or ‘Ars Sciendi Mori,’ translated from the Horologium Sapientiae of Heinrich Suso, plus a prologue of three stanzas, one of several works in verse and prose that form Hoccleve’s Series, usually preceded by 2621 and followed by 5663 but sometimes occurring separately—134 stanzas rhyme royal, including the prologue.
